item.title: Senior Data Analyst, Data & Reporting
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Analytics & Decision Science  team reporting into the Director, Business Intelligence. As a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll be responsible, at a senior level, for delivering insightful dashboards and reporting to ensure that Product teams have the right information to make the right decisions at the right time.  You’ll deliver a wide range of financial, behavioral, competitive analytic tools through the use of advanced business intelligence tools to help drive growth in our business.  The successful candidate will be an energetic and self-motivated individual with exceptional consultative skills and an intense client focus.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytics & Reporting – Lead the delivery of fact-based  dashboards and reporting tools to influence decisions and/or identify gaps.  The expectation is to go well beyond the numbers and provide insightful product/business/customer/client/segment analysis tools. Contribute to the development and management of a reporting/analytical intake process. Prepare presentations that clearly and concisely communicate key findings and objectives

  • Consultation – Participate as a thought partner and provide advice and recommendations that assist in the development and evolution of our business mandate and help our business make Better Decisions Faster

  • Data Management - Work collaboratively with IT & Product teams to augment/acquire internal and external data and tools to facilitate better decision making.  Develop Strategies that ensure data accuracy, consistency, timely capture and standardization at the  client and account levels across varying product groups

  • Leadership - Actively seek and evaluate opportunities to improve existing processes and work with key stakeholders to implement changes where appropriate. Contribute to the ongoing development and enhancement of a suite or reports and dashboards, data management and business intelligence tools that leverage industry best practices with respect to flexibility, sensitivity and reporting to allow enhanced support of the diverse range of clients across the business

Who You Are

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business and technical  problems and recommend solutions

  • You can demonstrate a deep understanding of developing dashboards, reporting, insights generation.  Accuracy and attention to detail are a must

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization

  • You have a degree in an advanced analytical designation (MBA, CA, CMA, CFA, MA, M.Sc, etc.) and/or equivalent progressive work experience within a large multi-dimensional organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class on-boarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 750 Law Ave. W., W6

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Business Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 81 Bay street, 25th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.description:

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You\'ll join our Analytics & Decision Science team reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence and Data Management. As a Consultant, you\'\'ll be responsible for delivering insightful dashboards and reporting to ensure that Product teams have the right information to make the right decisions at the right time.  You\'ll deliver a wide range of financial, behavioral, competitive analytic tools through the use of advanced business intelligence tools to help drive growth in our business.  The successful candidate will be an energetic and self-motivated individual with exceptional consultative skills and an intense client focus.

Assist as needed, in the preparation of presentations that clearly and concisely communicate key findings and objectives

Contribute to the ongoing development and enhancement of a suite or reports and dashboards, data management and business intelligence tools.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in an advanced analytical designation (MBA, CA, CMA, CFA, MA, M.Sc, etc.) and/or equivalent progressive work experience within a large multi-dimensional organization

item.title: Sr. Data Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to Senior Manager, Data Management, the incumbent is responsible to work closely with the Sr Manager, Data Management on the production and non-production databases. This will include managing database distribution, configuration, security and access requirements as well as designing and developing physical databases for complex applications and programing activities. In addition, the role will be responsible for operationalizing promotional chequing campaigns. This will include developing the code, testing, deploying into production, and running monthly campaign calculations.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Provide timely, fact-based  analytics and reporting to senior business leaders to influence decisions and/or identify gaps

  • Leading and/or providing subject matter expertise in production and non-production databases

  • Managing database distribution, configuration, security and access requirements

  • Designing and developing physical databases

  • Designing and developing supporting applications / tools for the front line (e.g., webforms used for activity input, campaign enrolment, etc.)

  • Performing testing, reporting, capacity planning, performance tuning, back-up and restores

  • Coordinate coding, testing , implementation, integration and documentation of solutions

  • Perform complex applications programming activities

  • Run and manage Campaign Fulfillment, Quality of Input applications, and other related applications

  • Act as SME for Chequing Campaigns; stewarding campaigns from design to deployment, determine eligibility and payouts, and answer all “how to” and “where is/are” inquiries

  • Develop and manage Simplii web projects, with varying degrees of complexity

  • Maintain strong knowledge and understanding of the Simplii Data Warehouse (DWH)

  • Participate in design walkthroughs  and meetings to gain a good understanding and be subject matter expert on what is being implemented.

  • Liaise/negotiate with Project Leads and Development teams to ensure any risks are identified and corrected before project completion

  • Identify and resolve medium to highly complex production problems for support of applications

  • Prioritizing and manage multiple requests, projects, and activities typically working under pressure

  • Apply knowledge of approaches, tools, and techniques to recognize, anticipate, and resolve organizational, operational, or process problems

  • Effectively communicate problems and resolutions

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of  experience in data warehouse design concepts, practices, techniques: relational and dimensional modeling, process modeling, ETL design, performance tuning and QA/test approaches

  • Strong knowledge of database design concepts and excellent data modeling and schema design skills

  • Experience programming and administering MS SQL Server databases, including development of stored procedures

  • Development competence using T-SQL

  • Knowledge of MS SQL issues related to database design and deployment

  • Thorough understanding of database performance tuning

  • Strong knowledge of SSIS, SSRS, SSAS

  • Must be able to effectively interact with stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications

  • Must successfully manage multiple priorities as this role will manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups or activities

  • A degree in software engineering, computer science or equivalent education and experience

  • Knowledge with Oracle and .NET an asset

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-595 Bay St., 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Senior Analyst, Metrics and Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Credit Adjudication team is responsible for the adjudication of Personal Lending across multiple brands (CIBC, Simplii and specialized brands), products (Secured and Unsecured) and distribution channels (Branch, Telephone, Internet, and Mobile). This unit also adjudicates the relatively higher dollar, higher risk profile, more complex credit applications submitted by Retail Banking. CA is responsible for leading and managing a team of over 350 individuals located in regional offices in Montreal, Toronto and Vancouver.

The Senior Analyst, Metrics and Analytics, Credit Adjudication will provide ongoing reporting and analytical support to improve risk management controls and optimize business performance. The incumbent will be responsible for in-depth data understanding, root-cause analysis, statistical analysis, scenario analysis and forecasting across different segments within CA to drive efficiency and increase insights into risk management practices and other CA processes. In addition, the Senior Analyst will lead and support evolving analytics capabilities (including development of new metrics, the use of new tools and methodologies, and databases). Your day will be spent liaising and establishing relationships with various lines of business personnel to identify and solicit the appropriate information for purposes of analysis, business case development , while managing multiple activities of varying complexities and maintaining the highest quality of output.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Driven Solutions: Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives. Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with practical industry experience is required here.
  • Business Partner Relationships: Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities. Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
  • Project Execution: Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in At least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS (required), SQL; comfort with exploring how new and emerging data.  Knowledge of data visualization tools such as ThoughtSpot.  Working in applied data & analytics problems in retail banking is an asset. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office including Excel, SharePoint and experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 9th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Senior Manager, Environmental Risk
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As the Senior Manager of Environmental Risk, you will be responsible for developing and enhancing policies and standards, managing environmental risks and opportunities, and improving CIBC’s performance, disclosures, and reputation related to the environment and climate change. You will also be responsible for developing recommendations related to minimizing the risks associated with climate change and providing independent oversight of the measurement, monitoring, and control of climate-related risk.   

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking – Translates and interprets abstract or theoretical information with a high level of attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency. Supports the preparation of CIBC’s greenhouse gas inventory related to our operations and our lending. Familiarity with the Greenhouse Gas Protocol – Corporate Accounting and Reporting Standard and the Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials (PCAF).
  • Communication and Collaboration –  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Develop internal and external communications to promote CIBC’s environmental initiatives and achievements. Represent CIBC on industry committees and working groups established to develop, pilot, and implement tools, guidance, and standards that support the industry’s transition to a lower carbon economy. Interact with environmental risk managers and peers at other major financial institutions for the purpose of exchanging information and collaborating on industry initiatives.
  • Leadership Skills - Driven by collective success, understands the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life. Actively engages and collaborates with teams across the bank to achieve results including reducing CIBC’s greenhouse gas emissions and the development of new products and services that positively impact the environment. Provide support and subject matter expertise for the effective management and implementation of a bank-wide environmental strategy and target setting. Advance corporate polices and standards, including the Corporate Environmental Policy and the Environmentally Responsible Procurement Standard. 
  • Reporting – Support the development of content for external reporting including CIBC’s Sustainability Report, Public Accountability Statement, external rating agency requests,  external press releases and  Environment website. Perform peer benchmarking and research reports related to emerging environmental topics and trends. Support the Senior Director in the preparation of environmental reporting for senior executives and board committees. 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5-7 years of experience, with a working knowledge of industry-wide environmental policies, practices and reporting frameworks.
  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Engineering, Sustainability, Environmental Science or related field.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have strong influencing skills in eliciting cooperation and consensus from others in the implementation of an environment risk program.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

item.title: Analytics Consultant, Fraud Analytics, Risk Management
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You will provide ongoing data analysis associated with rules management within CIBC’s fraud mitigation systems, conduct data extraction and manipulation using SAS for fraud reporting, assist the team in the development and application of complex statistical concepts/theories and predictions including cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models  and sampling.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking –Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.
  • Data Management – Creation and maintenance of SAS, Tableau and SQL programs to access a decision support data repository.  Database management/querying, and computer programming/software expertise.
  • Communication Skills–  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve. You are current in analytical techniques and constantly seek to improve your knowledge in this field.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible. You are curious and proactive, you constantly offer new solutions based on sound analysis.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-750 Law Ave. W., E4

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Data Analytics (Inactive), Fraud Analysis, Fraud Investigation (Inactive), Risk Management, Software Programming (SQL) (Inactive), Tableau

item.title: Data Analyst - Compliance Officer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

As part of the Capital Markets Compliance team, you will be responsible for reviewing processes to identify and recommend improvements with a focus on data analytics and automation, working with other team members in creating efficiency by developing automation tools such as writing macros to replace manual process. 

You will also be responsible for reviewing and conducting testing of Research reports, communications between Research personnel and investment bankers to identify suspicious or unusual activities, which may suggest a breach of CIBC’s information barrier procedures, policies or regulatory requirements. You will investigate, document and report such activities and recommend appropriate courses of action to Compliance management for consideration.

How you’ll succeed

  • Data analysis – Develop or augment tools to query data and work on database design with internal partners with an understanding of Compliance mandate and financial products. Apply a variety of analysis to interpret data and identify patterns.  Investigate, compile, document, and prepare information for regulatory inquiries using various systems. 
  • Compliance oversight – Review and conduct testing of research reports for compliance with regulatory requirements as well as CIBC World Market’s policies and procedures, escalating any non-compliance to Compliance management.  Monitor communications between Research personnel and investment bankers to ensure the communications are in compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies.  Maintain the records for internal Continuing Education program.

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience in Microsoft Excel, Access and SQL querying with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical expertise. You can write simple to complex macros by VBA in Excel with strong knowledge of SQL queries to automate multiple use of different programs. It’s an asset if you have knowledge of statistics.
  • You have knowledge of the activities of the Capital Markets division of a financial institution sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments in creative ways to day-to-day issues. Understanding of equity research reports, equity and other capital markets products and working knowledge of compliance practices, procedures and principles to perform in-depth analysis of trading transactions would also be considered an asset. You have strong communication and interpersonal skills and have the ability to communicate and influence assertively, clearly and concisely, both in writing and verbally.
  • You have a degree/diploma or equivalent in Mathematics or Statistics or Computer Science would be considered an asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
  • You know that details matter. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You\'re motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
  • You look beyond the moment. You know what you do will make a difference today and tomorrow. You look for new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

161 Bay Street, 39th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Senior Analytics Consultant, GPO
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Global Process Owner Accounting (GPO) Team is accountable for working to align all Capital Market (CM) strategic initiatives for people, policies and technologies across geographies with a mindset to optimize processes and eliminate process inefficiencies and redundancies. This role reports to the GPO director. You will embody the CIBC’s One Finance Vision and Guiding Principles.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Relationship management –  possess good teamwork, partnership and relationship building skills sufficient to act in a collaborative manner with team members and stakeholders from different backgrounds and experiences. You will liaise daily with Finance, Front Office and other Capital Markets’ stakeholder groups.
  • Accounting and Controls – draw on your controls & governance skill sets to design and implement processes that result in accurate, complete, and timely inputs used throughout Finance. You take a holistic view of problems end to end and develop deep understanding of the current state so you can recommend ways to do things better. You draw on your past experiences to lead significant break investigations and analysis which is then summarized and presented to key stakeholders.
  • Subject Matter Expertise - Provide subject matter expertise (SME) on business analytics serving as the lead on all reporting / data visualization projects to gather reporting and data visualization requirements and develop user reports and dashboards.
  • Data/Reporting - Deliver key design and solution on reporting and dashboarding projects as well to provide thought leadership on data capture and delivery for the overall project.
  • Advisory - Provide advisory and training to Finance users on the adoption and proper use of the business analytics tools.
  • Agility – drive value by integrating, standardizing and sustaining the processes throughout the CIBC. You will help in eliminating process inefficiencies and creating enterprise-wide changes by developing a good understanding of the current state processes, defining the target state, and helping establishing a plan to streamline.

Who You Are

  • You are an experienced data professional. You have 2 or more years of experience as a dashboarding or reporting specialist and 3 years of relevant industry experience. You have comprehensive knowledge of a number of workflow automation or data visualization tools / platforms with the ability to interpret complex business requirements. Practical DevOps, Alteryx & Tableau experience an asset
  • You can demonstrate experience with a strong Capital Markets accounting background in order to support the oversight and governance functions, including enhancement of financial controls across multiple groups.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Business, Finance or Accounting, a certificate in Data Science, or an equal combination of education and industry experience.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration, and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

18 York Street, 10th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Alteryx, Azure Devops, Business Analysis, Capital Markets, Tableau

item.title: Consultant, Quantitative Risk Modeling
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll De Doing

Credit Risk Modeling & Financial Crimes Risk Modeling has several duties with respect to risk models, including model development, governance, assessment and consultation. Reporting to the Director, Financial Crimes Risk Modeling, the Consultant Quantitative Risk Modeling will use statistical software such as Python, SAS Enterprise Guide and SAS Enterprise Miner, as well as other modeling software, to monitor and develop various advanced models and provide statistical expertise. The position will also act as a point of contact for communicating effectively to Risk Business Managers and other risk regulatory teams the  requirements, questions and concerns related to all Credit & Financial Crimes models.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Modeling & Analysis - Track the effectiveness of predictive models in order to evaluate their ongoing performance and keep them current. Conduct detailed quantitative analysis to support the development and implementation of new and existing models or scorecards within Credit Risk &  Financial Crimes.  Develop new models and characteristics to mitigate Credit, Fraud & AML risk across a broad variety of portfolios.

  • Relationship Management - Work closely with the different stakeholders  to facilitate effective dissemination of risk information to Senior Business Managers, Model vetting and other regulatory bodies  regarding models.

  • Research - Participate in research and analysis of evolving industry best practices in Credit Risk & Financial Crimes Risk systems and modelling.

Wo you are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative (analytics, statistics/mathematics/applied sciences) field. Post-graduate degree would be an asset

  • You can demonstrate experience in Credit Risk modeling with regards to model (scorecards) development, monitoring and have a good understanding of the business concepts, strategy and usage of these models. You also proficiency with advanced analytics, machine learning, statistical procedures and techniques to conceptualize, research, compile and translate analytical findings into meaningful applicable strategies and recommendations. In addition, you have applied experience working with Python and/or SAS and its statistical procedures techniques or other mathematical/statistical application tools used for advanced analytics. It’s an asset If you have expertise in Machine Learning and AI.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed and technical information in an impactful way

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.

  • ·Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

    Values matter to you

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home.

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity.

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Sr Analyst, Information Security
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You will join CIBC\'s Identity and Access Operations team as an Information Security Consultant to monitor, analyze, review, and remediate access to CIBC\'s technology. You will support the execution of our team\'s mandate by defining, implementing and reporting on key metrics and other defined measurements related to business deliverables and processes. You will provide technical expertise in development and support of all activities, processes, procedures and tools used for validating and insuring the integrity of information security.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Reporting and Metrics – You can identify metrics thresholds and business rules for measuring data quality and ensuring adherence with bank and regulatory standards. You have creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable approach that results in providing CIBC with optimum solutions to business issues/challenges. This includes performing specific data or analysis based on business user requests and contribution to automation of reporting requirements, design documents for data quality & data management. You have must experience with Python scripting, Excel and PowerPoint. Tableau experience is an asset. You have the ability to analyze raw data to provide predictive and prescriptive analytics.

  • Identity Analytics and Administration – You have the ability to identify compliant or appropriate access to infrastructure and data. This includes risk analysis of current and new use cases and continuous update of documentation. You have the ability to handle client escalations and prioritize activities. You will drive the identity management and process effectiveness in security processes and understand and follow Identity and Access Management (IAM) processes.

  • Consulting – You will be responsible for collaborating with projects and initiatives to create and execute access management for new/existing infrastructure, aligning with Identity & Access Management (IAM) initiatives and related policies, standards, and procedures to help enhance our information security posture. You will assist other teams in investigation of potential security incidents and provide recommendations to remediate.

  • Process Improvement – You will recommend solutions to enhance processes, eliminate risks, and improve the speed and quality of key services to our partners. You have the ability to apply appropriate tools to perform problem determination and root cause analysis; identify bottlenecks, redundancies and vulnerabilities of existing processes as they relate to identity and access management.

  • Technical Skills – You have Windows and Linux knowledge relating to Identity and Access, Infrastructure and application knowledge to identify datasets and to provide solutions for process and operational improvements. You have experience in SQL query, scripting (Python), advanced PowerPoint and Excel. Knowledge of Tableau and Visio is an asset.

  • Other Skills –You can link operational activities and risks to controls and standards. You understand risk management framework to incorporate risk assessment to operational and improvement initiatives.  Hands-on experience of the following tools and application is an asset: SailPoint IdentityIQ, ServiceNow, Varonis, ARS/AD

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in Information Security. Knowledge of identity and access management principal is required. It\'s an asset if you have experience with control, compliance, audit testing and provisioning. Experience in advancing continuous improvement agendas including process documentation is an asset. Experience with reporting tools is an asset.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Information Security, Computer Science, or related field experience. Knowledge of multiple infrastructure platforms such as NAS, UNIX, WINTEL, MSSQL, Oracle, DB2, Sybase, AS400, Active Directory is an asset.  

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

*** Prior to starting in this role, security checks, including a criminal record check must be successfully completed to the satisfaction of CIBC. An annual criminal record check may also be required.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
